intro: Uva lurida, commonly known as the redroot false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its reddish stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain tiny seeds. Uva lurida is often found in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and in woodland edges.
